intro: Pfaffia sericea var. glabrescens, commonly known as the velvetleaf arrowhead, is a perennial herb native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
